article:
Adipose tissue is an important endocrine organ that secretes numerous protein
hormones, including leptin, adiponectin, and resistin. These hormones generally
influence energy metabolism, which is of great interest to the understanding and
treatment of type 2 diabetes and obesity.

Their relative roles in modifying appetite, insulin resistance and
atherosclerosis are the subjects of intense research, as they may be modifiable
causes of morbidity in people with obesity.
